sourceDesc.ab: The text is taken from Alice's Adventures in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll, Puffin Penguin 2014 Edition

div.p: You are not attending! said the Mouse to Alice, severely. What are you thinking of?
I beg your pardon, said Alice very humbly: you had got to the fifth bend, I think?
I had not! cried the Mouse, sharply and very angrily.

p.quote:
A knot!
a wordplay on with the sound 'n' and pronunciation of 'kn'
phonetic wordplay;281

div.p: said Alice, always ready to make herself useful, and looking anxiously about her. Oh, do let me help to undo it!
I shall do nothing of the sort, said the Mouse, getting up and walking away. You insult me by talking such nonsense!
I didn’t mean it! pleaded poor Alice. But you’re so easily offended, you know!
The Mouse only growled in reply.
Please come back, and finish your story! Alice called after it. And the others all joined in chorus Yes, please do! But the Mouse only shook its head impatiently, and walked a little quicker.

What a pity it wouldn’t stay! sighed the Lory, as soon as it was quite out of sight. And an old Crab
a wordplay on the nautical creatures
phonetic wordplay;280

took the opportunity of saying to her daughter Ah, my dear! Let this be a lesson to you never to lose your temper! Hold your tongue, Ma! said the young Crab, a little snappishly. You’re enough to try the patience of an oyster!
I wish I had our Dinah here, I know I do! said Alice aloud, addressing nobody in particular. She’d soon fetch it back!

p.hi: Sticky note: had not/ a knot | old Crab/ an oyster
